result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christian Claude-Mitchell Williams

records.addlTxt: Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Expires 1/19/2022
Justice Point Violation (DISARGE - IN CUSTODY) Report
Justice Point Violation (Missed Alternate Contact) Report

Defendant Christian Claude-Mitchell Williams in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar. Any pretrial motions to be filed a week before the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Christian Claude-Mitchell Williams in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for an arraignment hearing. Arraignment held.  Original information has been e-filed; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading and pleads not guilty. Court authorizes transfer of case to Branch 15 for global resolution. Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christian Claude-Mitchell Williams in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Havas.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Rosa, Br. 35.  Arraignment scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:53 PM Defendant Christian Claude-Mitchell Williams in court with Attorney Ashley Fard.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Court took judicial notice of 21CF4067. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis Officer J. Maxwell. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy. Defense requests an arraignment date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Arraignment scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed.

Court ordered no contact with Azariah L.B.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Atty Ashley Fard appears via video for bail argument.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Christian Claude-Mitchell Williams in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Christian Claude-Mitchell Williams in custody.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christian Claude-Mitchell Williams appeared by video means with Attorney.  Due to assignment of Assistant District Attorney, the defendant is advised that case is reassigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3.  Court reserves defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea

 Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Christian Claude-Mitchell Williams
Current: 3245 W Colony Dr., Greenfield, WI 53221 United States  (Effective: 04-06-2022)
Prior: 5920 West Burnham Street, #2, West Allis, WI 53219
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
